comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Abram M. Carhart was born in Guilderland NY in 1844, and died by drowning in the Mississippi River, in 1863.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: More detail on Private Abram M. Carhart at books.google.com/books?id=1GIUAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA787&l... Heroes of Albany: A memorial of the patriot-martyrs of the city and county of Albany, who sacrificed their lives during the late war in defence of our nation, 1861-1865, with a view of what was done in the county to sustain the United States government; and also brief histories of the Albany regiments Also at www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=17097486

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Looking for the family relationships -- no luck so far.  According to familysearch.com Abram or Abraham Mead Carhart's mother was a Mead and Abraham was the only child familysearch knows about. He was married to an Eliza Jane.  Familysearch does not track his mother's family.

comment.author: 78778005@N04
comment._content: Looks like a lot later than 1860's (past 1865) and more 1870's by the lack of petticoats, the long skinny lines, the hair, the short bangs on the lady in the middle, and the high collars.
